title: A Tour in Tartan-Land
author: Bede, Cuthbert
snippet: In the crisis of his fate, Sir William had cried to St. Katherine to aid him ; and, in gratitude for her fancied interference, he built the Chapel of St. Katherine, in the Hopes, on the Pentland hills. The hill from whence the monarch viewed the chase is still called ' the King's Hill;' and the place where Sir William hunted is yet known by the name of 'the Knight's Field.'
